repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Education Sector Support
            Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education Sector Support
            Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund Project for
            Mozambique were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was moderate, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            government commitment at the highest level is critical to
            successful implementation of key education reforms. For
            example, dramatically increasing the number of teachers in
            the civil service could have only been accomplished by the
            government's budget and political commitment to this
            expansion. Regular meetings with stakeholders to review key
            monitoring indicators help in identifying key constraints in
            the system, prioritization of those constraints and
            interventions to address them. Increase in teacher supply
            should be accompanied by a detailed and implementable plan
            on continuous teacher education to ensure the increase in
            teachers lead to an improvement in education outcomes.
            Evaluations should be put in place during implementation to
            allow evidence based decision making about scaling up
            various alternative interventions. This was not done in this
            program however it is planned in the next education project.
            A results framework linking components to measurable
            baseline and target indicators should be prepared in advance
            of program implementation to be able to properly track
            program progress.

repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Education Sector Support
            Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund : environmental
            and social management framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education Sector
            Support Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund for
            Mozambique is to provide an environmental and social
            screening process to allow for the identification,
            assessment, and mitigation of potential negative
            environmental and social impacts related to the construction
            and rehabilitation of schools and special education centers
            and related water supply and sanitation systems in the
            schools. The adverse environmental impacts of the project
            will mainly come from the rehabilitation and construction
            works of the additional classrooms, schools, and teaching
            facilities and related water supply and sanitation systems
            (loss of vegetation, soil and ground water pollution, soil
            erosion, generation of solid and liquid wastes). Mitigation
            measures address:  (a) ensuring regular emptying, conduct
            hygiene education campaign to raise awareness of the health
            risks of exposed sewage, establishing and supporting
            affordable pump out services; (b) establishing a system to
            support the employment of a caretaker or routine cleaning
            and maintenance; and (c) protecting water resources putting
            them away from discharge areas of work sites wastes.

repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Education Sector Support
            Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund : resettlement plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education Sector
            Support Program Fast Track Initiative Catalytic Fund for
            Mozambique is to support the implementation of the Strategic
            Plan for Education and Culture 2006-2010/11 (SPEC) approved
            by the Council of Ministers, in particular focusing on
            primary and secondary education while ensuring capacity
            strengthening of the Ministry of Education and culture and
            its provincial and district departments in policy
            development, administration and implementation, monitoring,
            and evaluation. Some of the negative impacts of the project
            are: acquisition of land; production systems are dismantled,
            people face impoverishment if their productive assets, or
            income sources are lost; people are relocated to
            environments where their community institutions and social
            networks are weakened; and kin groups are dispersed and
            cultural identity, traditional authority, and the potential
            for mutual help are diminished or lost. Mitigation measures
            of the project are: 1) Avoiding or minimizing involuntary
            land acquisition and resettlement, where feasible and
            exploring all viable alternatives before resorting to
            involuntary resettlement. 2) Where involuntary resettlement
            and land acquisition is unavoidable, assistance and
            sufficient resources should be provided to the project
            affected persons with the view to maintaining and/or
            improving their standards of living, earning capacities, and
            production levels. 3) Encouraging community participation in
            planning and implementing and acquisition, compensation
            and/or resettlement, and provision of assistance to affected
            people regardless of the legality of their land rights or
            their title to land.
